description: Originally twite, an aphetism of Middle English atwite.

examples: What do you mean, since when did I become such a radical fairy? Since I started knowing twits like you, you twit!

entries.meaning: A person who twitters, i.e. chatters inanely.

verbs.description: twit (third-person singular simple present twits, present participle twitting, simple past and past participle twitted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reproach, blame; to ridicule or tease.
examples: "Hath he not twit our sovereign lady here
With ignominious words, though clerkly couch'd,
As if she had suborned some to swear
False allegations to o'erthrow his state? " -

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing) To ignore or killfile (a user on a bulletin board system).
examples: However, on the Internet BBS's such as Quartz (now dead), Prism, Monsoon, Sunset, ect[sic], someone pulling that kind of crap is likely to get flamed quite fast and twitted before he/she can breathe.
